Sedas

Probably best if we start by logging into sedas to be able to access datasets in their current format.

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

sedas_client[source]

sedas_client()

Log into sedas api.

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
sedas_client()

<sedas_pyapi.sedas_api.SeDASAPI at 0x7f0a49feabd0>
{% endraw %}

should inc. test for env vars...?

And we'll want to find datasets from different Collections, which sedas expects as groups. Will eventually need to add test endpoint to be able to access NovaSAR datasets.

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

sedas_get_collections[source]

sedas_get_collections()

{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
sedas_get_collections()

'Available groups are: Cosmo-SkyMed, SPOT, Pleiades, S1, S2, AIRSAR'
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

sedas_find_datasets[source]

sedas_find_datasets(wkt, startDate, endDate, collection)

{% endraw %}

For example for a small area over Oxford we can find...

{% raw %} 
result = sedas_find_datasets("POLYGON((-1.91 51.81,-1.15 51.81,-1.15 51.50,-1.91 51.50,-1.91 51.81))", 
                             "2000-01-01T00:00:00Z", 
                             "2020-10-27T00:00:00Z",
                             "Pleiades"
                            )

We can do a single download.

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

sedas_download[source]

sedas_download(sedas_res_dicts, down_dir, sedas=None)

Use product dicts list to download into a dir.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

sedas_extract[source]

sedas_extract(down_zip, scene_dir)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Cloud-Optimised Formatting

Once we have access to the datasets, we will want to convert raster images of any format into a default COG format. (It helps that COGs are now an official gdal driver.

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

convert2cog[source]

convert2cog(img_path, cog_path, band)

Convert gdal raster into COG with default settings. Considering lzw compression. See https://www.cogeo.org/developers-guide.html.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

mosaic2cog[source]

mosaic2cog(imgs, out_cog, band)

Mosaic imgs into cog. Usual vrt assumptions.

{% endraw %}

mosaic currently specific to pleiades ([:-13] for slicing name). Needs to be generalised a little more

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

cogmosaicbands[source]

cogmosaicbands(img_paths, numbands, basename)

Convert bands from img_paths to cog, output basename_band#.tif. Mosaic if >1 img paths.

{% endraw %}

Object Storage

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

s3_create_client[source]

s3_create_client(s3_bucket)

Create and set up a connection to S3 :param s3_bucket: :return: the s3 client object.

{% endraw %}

We can use this to connect to any S3-like object storage end point. Assumes env vars.

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

s3_single_upload[source]

s3_single_upload(in_path, s3_path, s3_bucket)

put a file into S3 from the local file system. :param in_path: a path to a file on the local file system :param s3_path: where in S3 to put the file. :return: None

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

get_rel_dir_s3_paths[source]

get_rel_dir_s3_paths(local_dir, s3_dir)

returns local path, remote path pair list.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

s3_upload_dir[source]

s3_upload_dir(in_dir, s3_bucket, s3_dir)

Upload all items in directory, inc. dir.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

s3_list_objects_paths[source]

s3_list_objects_paths(s3_bucket, prefix)

List of paths only returned, not full object responses

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

s3_list_objects[source]

s3_list_objects(s3_bucket, prefix)

{% endraw %}

setup_logging()

STAC

We can amend the default STAC I/O tools to work with our object storage.

First up is to be able to create a uri given an endpoint, bucket name and object path.

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

create_uri[source]

create_uri(s3_path, s3_bucket='public-eo-data', endpoint_url='http://s3-uk-1.sa-catapult.co.uk')

{% endraw %}

Amend the reading method.

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

my_read_method[source]

my_read_method(uri)

{% endraw %}

And the writing method.

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

my_write_method[source]

my_write_method(uri, txt)

{% endraw %}

Then allow us to overwrite the defaults.

{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

pystac_setIO[source]

pystac_setIO()

{% endraw %}
